Does the initial application of \\( x(s) = e^{Bs}y \\) determine the state of \\( z(T) \\) entirely, assuming no changes are made to the matrices A and B after initial set-up?
Explanation: The initial setup with \\( x(s) = e^{Bs}y \\) fully determines the function \\( z(t) \\) through the integral transform, where dependencies are explicitly set by B influencing the evolution of x over time and thus directly impacting the output through A. There is a deterministic path from setup to output in this linear time-invariant system.
